event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Sun Crypto Accelerator 4000 Firmware May Be Defective Or Hardware May Be Faulty
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: The Solaris Fault Manager has determined that a firmware defect or hardware fault was detected on Sun Crypto Accelerator 4000 card which requires repair action.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: The driver has been disabled and unregistered as a hardware provider to the Solaris Cryptographic Framework.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: The card will no longer function as a network device or cryptographic accelerator until the problem has been resolved.
event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item:
Run the SCA4000 diagnostic tests on the adapter (rsrc) identified in the fmdump(1M) output as instructed in the Sun Crypto Accelerator 4000 Board Installation and Users Guide.

If diagnostic tests fail, perform a keystore backup and schedule a repair procedure to replace the affected adapter.

Run pkgchk -n SUNWvcafw to ensure that the latest firmware package is correctly installed and has been downloaded to the adapter (rsrc) identified in the fmdump(1M) output as instructed in the Sun Crypto Accelerator 4000 Board Installation and Users Guide.

If the latest firmware has already been correctly installed, contact Sun for support
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
The Message ID:  %MSGID% indicates diagnosis has determined that the firmware running on the SCA4000 PCI adapter is defective or the hardware is faulty. The SCA4000 (vca) driver has disabled the network and cryptographic accelerator interfaces. Insure that the latest firmware package (SUNWvcafw) is installed on the system and that the firmware supplied with that package (sca4000fw) has been downloaded to the card. The version 2.0 driver only supports version 2.0 firmware.

Refer to the Sun Crypto Accelerator 4000 Board Installation and Users Guide for information on determining version of firmware currently running on the card and downloading the correct version if necessary.

After installing the latest firmware on the card, diagnostic tests should be run to isolate the source of the problem. If diagnostics fail, the problem is most likely due to a hardware fault and the card should be replaced. If diagnostic tests pass and the problem persists, contact Sun for support.

After installing the latest firmware version or replacing the card, the network and cryptographic accelerator interfaces may be brought back into service using the fmadm(1M) command:

fmadm repair <EVENT-ID>
